question: As per the fifth annual Employment-Unemployment Survey (EUS) conducted countrywide, which State/UT has the highest unemployment rate in the country?
explanation: As per the fifth annual Employment-Unemployment Survey, the state topping the list in terms of unemployment rate is Tripura (19.7 percent), followed by Sikkim (18.1 percent), Lakshadweep (16.1 percent), Andaman & Nicobar Islands (12.7 percent), Kerala (12.5 percent) and Himachal Pradesh (10.6 percent). Gujarat has the least unemployment rate.
